What I ended up doing was creating a string buffer, and with each
failure I=
 added the url and the error message with a control n at the
end. And I ass=
erted on whether the string was empty and if not it
outputed the string wit=
h assertEquals(message, object, objectToCompare)

Karen

roups.com, "David Jackman" <david.jackman@f...> wrote:

ect: [junit] displaying multiple errors from the same condition

> =
I have a test that pings a URL to see if a webservice is available.
> 
> I =
do not want the test to have be aware of the specific URLs being
> tested. =
I go to the database where the URLs are stored and then open a
> URL connec=
tion and ping the service. 
> 
> I iterate through the URLs, and collect th=
e results. I want to be able
> to display a message for all the URLs that f=
ail. But I cannot see how
> to do that.
> 
> This test only does on thing, =
so I don't think this is a case where I
> need to break up the test. Also I=
 don't want to have to be aware of
> what URLs fail before hand by checking=
 specific URLs with assertEquals.
> 
> Is there a way I can display multipl=
e errors or failures, in Junit?
> I have read the FAQ about the logic for n=
ot being able to display
> multiple results, but I don't feel like the argu=
ment is applicable here.
> 
> If there is a previous response, please fowar=
ed the message id, when

artial results'.

> Thanks, Karen
